WorkItem.Description:
I keep getting an error when I'm trying to run Rawr.WPF.exe, keeps coming up with the error of: To run this application, you first must install one of the following versions of the .NET Framework: v4.0.30319.  The only problem with that is that I just
 installed the newest version and restarted and I'm still getting this error.
 
 
 
Someone please help!  Thanks in advance.
WorkItem.Summary: .NET Framework error trying to install RAWR

Comments.Message:
Can you check the following to verify that the .NET Framework installed correctly?

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/kbarticle.aspx?id=318785

Did that with the last version. I am checking on that now. Noticed 2 folds in the regedit for version 4.... a v4 and a v4.0.   The v4 folder has the usual goodies while the v4.0 folder had a single line showing  REG_SZ and deprecated (under data).  Using the .NET download repair feature at the moment to verify. If that fails, will try removal and reinstall.

Interestingly enough, Kavan, while I cannot find one iota of difference in the registry, or anywhere else, it seems that running the .NET download through its Repair process fixed something.  I wish I could tell you what it fixed but since the .Net is the same version and all data is identical after repair, I cannot.

What I can safely say is that a post can be made that REGARDLESS of the Error Message, if RAWR fails to launch, the first step is to ALWAYS run the .NET download (in this case dotNetFx40_Full_setup.exe for me) and either 1) Install or 2) Repair.

Thanks for you patience. It was simply too odd for the 4.2.3 to run and the 4.2.4 to not... so running a Repair did not make sense.  Not sure what it fixed, but RAWR 4.2.4 is up and running. :-))

~Tex
